title.title: شرح فصول أبقراط لجالينوس
Galen's Commentary on the Hippocratic Aphorisms
Sharḥ Fuṣūl Abuqrāṭ li-Gālīnūs

msItem.note: This isḤunayn ibn Ishaq's Translation of Galen's commentary on the Hippocratic Aphorisms.

supportDesc.extent: 1 initial flyleaf, 166 leaves, 2 final flyleaves (fols. i, 1a-166b, ii-iii) 250mm 160mm

layout.p: One column with 28 lines for the first hand
One column with 20 lines for the second hand

handDesc.handNote: The text is written in maghribi. Two hands are involved in the copy. They are different in type of ink, colour of rubrics, and text area. The portion by the first hand isfols.1b-88b(henceforth called the first part), which contains book 4 to book 7, andfols. 161a-166b(henceforce called the third part), which starts from a middle of book 3 Aph. 23 to the end of book 3. The rest of it, i.e., fols.89a-160b(henceforth called the second part), which starts from a middle of book 1 Aph. 12 to a middle of book 3 Aph. 18, is by another hand.

additions.p: Marginalia: The first and third parts have been collated with the exemplar by the first hand. The copyist has entered many corrections in the margins (sometimes marked with صح [corrected] or ط [a marginal note (طرّة)]), and has numbered aphorisms in the margins. The second part has been collated with exemplar as well as with another manuscript by the second hand, who has entered many notes in the margins (sometimes marked with صح or نخ [in a manuscript (نسخة)]), and has added a folio (that is, fol. 106) entitled "طرة [a marginal note]" to supply a lacking part in the text, which corresponds to a part of book1 Aph. 20. Aphorisms in this part also have been numbered by the second hand. Also another hand has put notes in the margins (sometimes marked with ط; e.g., 95a, 108a, 109a, 110a, 116a, 121a, 124b, 133b, 147a, 156b).

origin.note: The copy is unnamed and undated.Derenbourg-Renaudestimates the date of the first hand around13CEand the date of the second hand aroundthe 15th century.
